datasource.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

count.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

skip_to.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

with_meta.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

with_contents_hash.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

skip.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

format.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

filter.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

key.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

pattern.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

datasource_format.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

unfiltered_count.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

stat-items.description: Items to count occurrence in entire response (multiple items should be separated by '|').

primary_keys.description: The primary key to find indexes for.

action.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
json-schema: Return JSON Schema for entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

before.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

after.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

nkey.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

GET.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: fwgrp

POST.summary:
Create object(s) in this table.
 Access Group: fwgrp

PUT.summary:
Update this specific resource.
 Access Group: fwgrp

DELETE.summary:
Delete this specific resource.
 Access Group: fwgrp

replacemsg-group.name: replacemsg-group
replacemsg-group.help: Name of the replacement message group to be used.

options.help: Disable logging for antivirus oversize file blocking.
options.label: Disable

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable logging for antivirus oversize file blocking.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable logging for antivirus oversize file blocking

switching-protocols-log.help: Enable/disable logging for HTTP/HTTPS switching protocols.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable logging for HTTP/HTTPS switching protocols.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable logging for HTTP/HTTPS switching protocols

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable logging for HTTP/HTTPS switching protocols.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable logging for HTTP/HTTPS switching protocols

ports.name: ports
ports.help: Ports to scan for content (1 - 65535, default = 80).

status.name: status
status.help: Enable/disable the active status of scanning for this protocol.

inspect-all.name: inspect-all
inspect-all.help: Enable/disable the inspection of all ports for the protocol.

proxy-after-tcp-handshake.name: proxy-after-tcp-handshake
proxy-after-tcp-handshake.help: Proxy traffic after the TCP 3-way handshake has been established (not before).

options.name: options
options.help: One or more options that can be applied to the session.

comfort-interval.name: comfort-interval
comfort-interval.help: Interval between successive transmissions of data for client comforting (seconds).

comfort-amount.name: comfort-amount
comfort-amount.help: Number of bytes to send in each transmission for client comforting (bytes).

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable range header blocking (allow partial file downloads)
options.label: Disable

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable range header blocking (treat all partial file downloads as full file download)
options.label: Enable

strip-x-forwarded-for.name: strip-x-forwarded-for
strip-x-forwarded-for.help: Enable/disable stripping of HTTP X-Forwarded-For header.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable changing of HTTP X-Forwarded-For header.
options.label: Disable

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable replacement of X-Forwarded-For value with 1.1.1.1.
options.label: Enable

post-lang.name: post-lang
post-lang.help: ID codes for character sets to be used to convert to UTF-8 for banned words and DLP on HTTP posts (maximum of 5 character sets).

streaming-content-bypass.name: streaming-content-bypass
streaming-content-bypass.help: Enable/disable bypassing of streaming content from buffering.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable bypassing of streaming content from buffering
options.label: Enable

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable bypassing of streaming content from buffering
options.label: Disable

switching-protocols.name: switching-protocols
switching-protocols.help: Bypass from scanning, or block a connection that attempts to switch protocol.

unknown-http-version.name: unknown-http-version
unknown-http-version.help: How to handle HTTP sessions that do not comply with HTTP 0.9, 1.0, or 1.1.

options.name: reject
options.help: Reject or tear down HTTP sessions that do not use HTTP 0.9, 1.0, or 1.1.
options.label: Reject

options.name: tunnel
options.help: Pass HTTP traffic that does not use HTTP 0.9, 1.0, or 1.1 without applying HTTP protocol optimization, byte-caching, or web caching. TCP protocol optimization is applied.
options.label: Tunnel

options.name: best-effort
options.help: Assume all HTTP sessions comply with HTTP 0.9, 1.0, or 1.1. If a session uses a different HTTP version, it may not parse correctly and the connection may be lost.
options.label: Best Effort

http-0.9.name: http-0.9
http-0.9.help: Configure action to take upon receipt of HTTP 0.9 request.

options.name: allow
options.help: Allow HTTP 0.9 traffic for web filtering only.
options.label: Allow

tunnel-non-http.name: tunnel-non-http
tunnel-non-http.help: Configure how to process non-HTTP traffic when a profile configured for HTTP traffic accepts a non-HTTP session. Can occur if an application sends non-HTTP traffic using an HTTP destination port.

options.name: enable
options.help: Pass non-HTTP sessions through the tunnel without applying protocol optimization, byte-caching, or web caching. TCP protocol optimization is applied.
options.label: Enable

options.name: disable
options.help: Drop or tear down non-HTTP sessions accepted by the profile.
options.label: Disable

options.name: enable
options.help: Allow h2c HTTP connection upgrades. h2c tunnels do not support content scan.
options.label: Enable

options.name: disable
options.help: Do not allow h2c HTTP connection upgrades.
options.label: Disable

unknown-content-encoding.name: unknown-content-encoding
unknown-content-encoding.help: Configure the action the FortiGate unit will take on unknown content-encoding.

options.name: block
options.help: Block HTTP session when unknown content-encoding is detected.
options.label: Block

options.name: inspect
options.help: Scan HTTP traffic as plain-text when unknown content-encoding is detected.
options.label: Inspect

options.name: bypass
options.help: Bypass scan when unknown content-encoding is detected.
options.label: Bypass

oversize-limit.name: oversize-limit
oversize-limit.help: Maximum in-memory file size that can be scanned (MB).

uncompressed-oversize-limit.name: uncompressed-oversize-limit
uncompressed-oversize-limit.help: Maximum in-memory uncompressed file size that can be scanned (MB).

uncompressed-nest-limit.name: uncompressed-nest-limit
uncompressed-nest-limit.help: Maximum nested levels of compression that can be uncompressed and scanned (2 - 100, default = 12).

stream-based-uncompressed-limit.name: stream-based-uncompressed-limit
stream-based-uncompressed-limit.help: Maximum stream-based uncompressed data size that will be scanned in megabytes. Stream-based uncompression used only under certain conditions (unlimited = 0, default = 0).

scan-bzip2.name: scan-bzip2
scan-bzip2.help: Enable/disable scanning of BZip2 compressed files.

verify-dns-for-policy-matching.name: verify-dns-for-policy-matching
verify-dns-for-policy-matching.help: Enable/disable verification of DNS for policy matching.

block-page-status-code.name: block-page-status-code
block-page-status-code.help: Code number returned for blocked HTTP pages (non-FortiGuard only) (100 - 599, default = 403).

retry-count.name: retry-count
retry-count.help: Number of attempts to retry HTTP connection (0 - 100, default = 0).

options.name: block
options.help: Block and log domain fronting. Will not block potential matching IP and Domain.
options.label: Block

options.name: strict
options.help: Block and log domain fronting. Will block potential matching IP and Domain.
options.label: Strict

options.name: dynamic
options.help: Vary TCP window size based on available memory and within limits of tcp-window-minimum and tcp-window-maximum.
options.label: Dynamic
